intro: Echeveria ochoae, commonly known as the Ochoa's Echeveria, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It features rosettes of fleshy, thick leaves that are typically blue-gray to silver in color. The plant produces striking violet to pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright sunlight to maintain its vibrant appearance. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
